body: Fixed in the master.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.
This is a compile version only. Don't accept bot update.
@dependabot ignore this major version
OK, I won't notify you about version 4.x.x again, unless you re-open this PR or update to a 4.x.x release yourself.
Is it a real different in our case? I used to check on that too
What do you want to say? I am confusing.
Agent is generating new class to do instrumentation, of course it costs heap size. So?
@dmsolr  Note that this PR has modifications to the ```mock-collector``` and ```validator``` modules
Your code format is not right, could you adjust that in markdown? It is hard to follow.
Your test case is failing, please recheck.

> add sw istio adapter

@hanahmily @innerpeacez Is this going to be a bypass adaptor test first?
@innerpeacez Thanks, great job! except for some nits, I think you have finished first step.

> I think that we need to add some docs in this dir, tell our user about preconditions. such as `kubectl` and `helm` tools should be installed before.

yes, we should document it and add a link from the `docs` folder. @innerpeacez we should figure it out after all scripts are written.

> > add sw istio adapter
> 
> @hanahmily @innerpeacez Is this going to be a bypass adaptor test first?

We will. after we finish all the steps.

> > I think that we need to add some docs in this dir, tell our user about preconditions. such as `kubectl` and `helm` tools should be installed before.
> 
> yes, we should document it and add a link from the `docs` folder. @innerpeacez we should figure it out after all scripts are written.

I will try to add documentation after I complete all the steps.
Do you even read doc? Es6 is supported long time ago.
/run agent-plugin-test-2
You are not following SkyWalking core API. Why you change the `contextCarrier` by your self? Once you changed, I don't know what you mean.

I have client and service endpoint. I need to bind two spans with the same traceId. I use the way transfer CarrierItem in my Message Header. However, it is not working. 

I might not have deep understanding. Could you guide me about how to link two spans with the same traceId? really appreciate.
Do you read the existing MQ codes? ContextCarrier has APIs to deal with it already. Clearly, you are using the incorrect way.
希望能早日得到支持~！
@maodie English only, and you have the SpringMVC, shouldn't require JBoss

@innerpeacez Thanks a lot for what you accomplish. I think the first step has been done. we can move forward. 
Since we have a deal about the principle of artifacts. you can push more steps at a same time rather than one by one.

I'm missing the context of PR a little. Do you intend to make consumer threads to observe the change of "queue" with the help of `volatile`?
If your assumption is correct, some consumers will be busier than others. But from the graph, I didn't check it out.
@hanahmily I was being reported by community, the consumers are not fully working. That is the context
It is working! Thanks a lot!

> @hanahmily I was being reported by community, the consumers are not fully working. That is the context

What's the state of these consumers? I think that's a clue for us to find out why.
@kezhenxu94 All tests skip successfully with the only doc changed.

> What's the state of these consumers? I think that's a clue for us to find out why.

We just know the threads are not busy from the graph. Don't know why. As we have reduced the number of threads, should be a problem.

A remind, before you add anything to the jenkins file to start the CI, make me known. And if you are going to package containet image, I am assuming yes. Please specific the version as unique, and remember to clear all in jenkins clearup stage.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37059529/67840129-23416100-fb30-11e9-8a64-58b1611da941.png)

> A remind, before you add anything to the jenkins file to start the CI, make me known. And if you are going to package containet image, I am assuming yes. Please specific the version as unique, and remember to clear all in jenkins clearup stage.

Follow-up， I will add a cleanup script
And you are facing concurrency situation, so, make sure ID(version mostly) is UUID rather than any static value. Because there could be multiple jobs running.
Yes. More than 2 should be OK.
Are you referring to the version of sw? Currently sw is started with the latest image.
How do you find this? :O You are using ALS?
@wu-sheng i will immigrate httpasyncclient-scenario

> How do you find this? :O You are using ALS?

Our local repo has sonar.
What is the full name of ALS? Baidu can not get it. 🤣
What do you mean `SNMP`? And what is the meaning of `Service now for ticketing`? Hard to follow
You should read GraphQL, codes and query procotol. They are there already.

We are using Servicenow as a ticketing tools, where we forwards SNMP traps from any source and Servicenow will raise a ticket and assign to respective team.

So is it possible in skywalking ?

If there is any Mail notification features, it will also helpful
Notification for what? That is my question.

Alerting Notification, If I have configured any alert condition in skywalking, how can I notify to respective team?

I am new in skywalking, so not fully aware about skywalking functionality.
We have webhook already for alerting. So, you could build a layer to forward and transform the format again.

> You should read GraphQL, codes and query procotol. They are there already.

@wu-sheng should i read https://github.com/apache/skywalking-query-protocol ?
Including this, and codes. As you want to change, not just using.

@wu-sheng emm, code is hard to me, i'm not developer 😃 . 
And i can't find any query type about cache or mq, are you sure it's been already implemented?
For cache and MQ, NO. So I asked you to read codes, how database did. If you are not a developer, I assume it is impossible.
ok, maybe i need to ask my colleague for some help , but anyway, thank you. 🍎
shardingsphere-scenario for me
No. That is out of APM scope.
Thanks for your response. It may not strictly fall into APM territory. But it is related when deploying in cloud.  There are APMs cover this feature as well.
Yes, that is APM vendor product. It is provided by many projects. We don't need to build again.

After we got following graphs, this PR might be merged.

1. All of pods are up successfully.
1. Bookinfo application are showed up in UI.
~~Hi, I modified the ```apm-toolkit-trace-scenrio``` to validate the changes to the ```validator```~~
Related to #3583
ok
And next time, you put the execution time list in the PR description too. Please move this task. FYI @arugal
@wu-sheng  are you @me , maybe you spell error.
Both of you. I think I find the workload2 is faster?
i have check, workload-1 is faster workload-2   Dozens of seconds
Have you checked grouo by group? Because the parallel grouos are not in the same time.
I am comparing the longest time, another group of the task with a short total time. Maybe this will make the total time execution the shortest
OK. Then at least, next test should be add into workload2, group1. It is the fastest today.
/run agent-plugin-test-1

@JaredTan95 Do you have time to add this in these two days? As @x22x22 should submit UI update in this weekend, we should have 4-5 days to land this feature. If you are too busy, we could move this to 6.6.

Please confirm.
Be aware, this `gRPCHook` could be updated through dynamic configuration feature. And, I am assuming only one gRPC endpoint should be enough, what do you think?
I am thinking about `webhooks` should keep one only, but for compatible, we could keep it unchanged. @kezhenxu94 Only idea about this?

@ascrutae please confirm.

@viswaramamoorthy do you intend to submit a pull request to fix this?

> I am thinking about `webhooks` should keep one only, but for compatible, we could keep it unchanged. @kezhenxu94 Only idea about this?

Agree to keep it only one, but it's trivial and incompatible, it should be better to let it be

Network issue? This seems a grpc internal issue.
Meaning, the peer has disconnected. May be caused by timeout, client shutdown, etc.

@hanahmily @innerpeacez Please evaluate how many resources do your task need. From my understanding, a lot of pods and at least need a separated task out of e2e, which will use one executor in Jenkins. 

@kezhenxu94 Considering to set a `Service Mesh e2e` task later.
All steps are completed，Help review again, thanks a lot. @hanahmily
If you are running in JStorm, it is because of your own codes. I don't understand why you ask for our help?
I tested ，my code is ok , I don't  understand why the same code main run  is ok , but in jstorm bolt run is stucked

Why should we know? We don't use jstorm in any part of SkyWalking. Clearly, you are doing all the things in the private or even commercial version. This can't be supported from the open source community.
ok, thinks！
will send a PR

Read the things happen at #3583, I will recommend you to move the RabbitMQ test case into the main repo. The latest document for new test framework is not ready, but the new one is very similar the to  old one, check the old test repo and document
- repo, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/tree/master/rabbitmq-scenario
- document, https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases#document
FYI @dmsolr
@wu-sheng  Jenkins task has been set up with context name `Jenkinsfile-E2E-Mesh` and is ready to go whenever a file named `Jenkinsfile-E2E-Mesh` is checked in to the codebase

> @kezhenxu94 Thanks, what is the command for rerun?
> @innerpeacez @hanahmily Please set the label to `jenkins-skywalking5`, to make the tests always running in the same VM, to check the resources are cleaned correctly. Also, please take reference from other Jenkins file.
> 
> 1. Files created by the Docker image must be removed by another container, because of OS user.
> 2. Images of SkyWalking and containers of all need to be removed. Otherwise, the disk will be no space left.

use `/run service mesh e2e` to re-run the job if needed
`/run service mesh e2e` not `/run service-mesh-e2e`?

> `/run service mesh e2e` not `/run service-mesh-e2e`?

well, forgive me, thanks for correcting me, it's `/run service-mesh-e2e`
